episodeTitle: The Fierce Fight Begins! Luffy vs. Hordy!
episodeTitleJapanese: 激闘開始！ルフィVSホーディ！
description: Hody defeats Vander Decken and pursues Shirahoshi with his incredible underwater speed. Luffy intervenes to protect her while intense battles rage across Gyoncorde Plaza. Hyouzou becomes dangerously enhanced from Energy Steroid overdose.

events.title: Hody Defeats Vander Decken IX
events.description: Hody Jones pulls his trident from Vander Decken's body after a short confrontation. Before losing consciousness, Decken touches Hody with his left hand and throws an axe at him as a final act.
events.significance: Marks the end of the Hody-Decken alliance and eliminates Decken as a threat, allowing Hody to pursue his own agenda without interference.

events.title: Hody Pursues Shirahoshi
events.description: After defeating Vander Decken, Hody goes after Shirahoshi with incredible underwater speed. He slices through her brothers Ryuboshi and Manboshi with the blade on his back, then grabs Shirahoshi by her hair.
events.significance: Demonstrates Hody's enhanced abilities and ruthlessness, creating a critical moment where Shirahoshi is in immediate danger.

events.title: Gomu Gomu no Snake Shot Debut
events.description: Luffy debuts a new post-timeskip technique, Gomu Gomu no Snake Shot, hitting Hody in the chest with a swerving snake-like attack that forces him to release Shirahoshi. The technique breaks one of Hody's ribs.
events.significance: First appearance of this post-timeskip Luffy technique, showcasing his evolved fighting abilities with animal-themed variations.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy attacks Hody to protect Shirahoshi

events.title: Main Battle: Luffy vs. Hody Begins
events.description: After saving Shirahoshi, Luffy and Hody Jones begin their direct confrontation in the waters around Gyoncorde Plaza, marking the start of the arc's climactic battle.
events.significance: The title battle of the episode begins, pitting the protagonist against the arc's main antagonist in an underwater fight.

events.title: Hyouzou's Energy Steroid Overdose
events.description: Hyouzou consumes too many Energy Steroids while drunk, causing a complete physical transformation. His appearance changes dramatically as the steroids take effect, making him exponentially more powerful and dangerous.
events.significance: Demonstrates the dangerous side effects and transformation caused by Energy Steroid abuse, while significantly raising the threat level in the plaza.

events.title: Nuru's Debut and Challenge to Zoro
events.description: Nuru, an anime-original angler fish-man swordsman, challenges Zoro claiming he wants to become the strongest swordsman of Fish-Man Island. He uses his luminescent esca to blind Zoro during their fight.
events.significance: Introduces an anime-original character who serves as a warm-up opponent before Zoro's battle with Hyouzou.

events.title: Zoro Defeats Nuru
events.description: Zoro defeats the angler fish-man Nuru by shattering his luminescent esca into pieces. However, the drugged and enhanced Hyouzou then delivers a finishing blow to the already defeated Nuru.
events.significance: Concludes the anime-original fight and demonstrates the indiscriminate violence of the steroid-enhanced Hyouzou.

events.title: Chidoriashi Hash Debut
events.description: The steroid-enhanced Hyouzou uses his Eight Sword Style technique Chidoriashi Hash (Drunken Staggering Hash), swinging all eight swords to cut through multiple New Fish-Man Pirates members and the Iron Shell Squad's shields with ease.
events.significance: Demonstrates Hyouzou's dramatically increased power after the Energy Steroid overdose, making him a serious threat even to his own allies.

events.title: Wadatsumi Defeats Surume
events.description: Zeo manipulates Wadatsumi into believing Decken didn't abandon him. After taking an Energy Steroid, Wadatsumi gains enhanced strength and defeats Surume with a single powerful blow.
events.significance: Shows the effectiveness of the Energy Steroids in boosting physical power and sets up Wadatsumi as a renewed threat to the Straw Hats' allies.

events.title: Jinbe's Nanasenmaigawara Mawashigeri
events.description: Jinbe uses his Fish-Man Karate technique Nanasenmaigawara Mawashigeri (7000 Brick Roundhouse Kick) to block Wadatsumi's massive punch, breaking one of the giant's fingers. This is Jinbe's first Fish-Man Karate technique using his legs.
events.significance: Debuts a powerful new Jinbe technique and demonstrates his ability to fight against much larger opponents using Fish-Man Karate mastery.

events.title: Sanji Defends Nami's Honor
events.description: When Wadatsumi falls after being attacked by Jinbe, the impact blows Nami away. Enraged that Nami was hurt, Sanji kicks Wadatsumi in the head and declares he will pay for harming her.
events.significance: Classic character moment showcasing Sanji's protective devotion to Nami, reinforcing his chivalrous personality trait.

quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji attacks Wadatsumi after Nami is blown away

events.title: Zoro Confronts Enhanced Hyouzou
events.description: The steroid-enhanced Hyouzou attempts to attack Robin with his eight swords, but Zoro jumps in front of him and stops the attack, preparing to face the drugged swordsman.
events.significance: Sets up the upcoming Zoro vs. Hyouzou battle and shows Zoro protecting his crewmate, establishing the next major fight of the arc.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy uses his new technique to save Shirahoshi from Hody

quotes.speaker: Sanji
quotes.context: Sanji attacks Wadatsumi after Nami is blown away

themes.description: The episode emphasizes characters putting themselves in danger to protect others, from Luffy saving Shirahoshi to Zoro protecting Robin and Sanji defending Nami.
themes.symbolism: Each Straw Hat's protective action reflects their core values and bonds with their allies.

themes.description: The Energy Steroids provide immense power but at terrible costs, shown through Hyouzou's transformation and loss of control.
themes.symbolism: The steroids represent the dangers of seeking power through artificial means and shortcuts.

characterSpotlights.development: Demonstrates his post-timeskip combat abilities and unwavering determination to protect his friends, particularly Shirahoshi.
keyActions: Debuts Gomu Gomu no Snake Shot technique

characterSpotlights.development: Shows his ruthlessness by defeating his former ally Decken and his incredible underwater combat abilities.
Faces multiple opponents and prepares to battle the enhanced Hyouzou, showcasing his protective instincts toward Robin.
Transforms into a dangerous, uncontrolled force after overdosing on Energy Steroids, becoming a threat to everyone.
keyActions: Uses Chidoriashi Hash to cut down allies and enemies alike

mangaDifferences.difference: Zoro fights an anime-original character named Nuru, an angler fish-man swordsman, before facing Hyouzou. This character and fight do not appear in the manga.
Hyouzou's complete physical transformation from Energy Steroid overdose is shown in full detail in the anime, whereas the manga shows less of the transformation process.
In the anime, Hody's underlings do not know what is causing Hyouzou's transformation, but in the manga some of them recognize it's from Energy Steroids.

trivia.fact: Episode 560 adapts Chapter 639 of the manga, titled 'Protect Everything', covering pages 2-19.
This episode aired exactly one year before Episode 612 on August 18, 2013 (simulcast date).
Gomu Gomu no Snake Shot makes its debut in this episode as one of Luffy's new post-timeskip techniques with an animal-theme naming convention.

sources.title: Gomu Gomu no Mi/Techniques - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: Nanasenmaigawara Mawashigeri is Jinbe's first Fish-Man Karate attack that involves his legs and feet rather than his hands.
The episode received a 7.3/10 rating on IMDb based on viewer reviews.

sources.title: Gekitou Kaishi! Luffy Tai Hody! - IMDb
